name: Minimum Information About a Plant Phenotyping Experiment
description: A checklist for description of plant phenotyping experiments

attributes.name: ExpID
attributes.label: Experiment unique ID
attributes.definition: Unique identifier comprising the name or identifier for the institution/database hosting the submission of the experiment data, and the identifier of the experiment in that institution.

attributes.name: ExpTitle
attributes.label: Experiment title
attributes.definition: Human-readable text summarising the experiment
attributes.example: 2002 evaluation of flowering time for a panel of 375 maize lines at the experimental station of Maugio (France).

attributes.name: Description
attributes.label: Experiment description
attributes.definition: Human-readable text describing the experiment
attributes.example: 2002 evaluation of male and female flowering time for a panel of 375 maize lines representing the worldwide genetic diversity at the experimental station of Maugio, France.

attributes.name: StartDate
attributes.label: Start date of experiment
attributes.definition: Date and, if relevant, time when the experiment started

attributes.name: EndDate
attributes.label: End date of experiment
attributes.definition: Date and, if relevant, time when the experiment ended

attributes.name: Institution
attributes.label: Contact institution
attributes.definition: Name and address of the institution responsible for the experiment.
attributes.example: UMR de Génétique Végétale, INRA – Université Paris-Sud – CNRS, Gif-sur-Yvette, France

attributes.name: Country
attributes.label: Geographic location (country)
attributes.definition: The country where the experiment took place, either as a full name or preferably as a 2-letter code.

attributes.name: Site
attributes.label: Experimental site name
attributes.definition: The name of the natural site, experimental field, greenhouse, phenotyping facility, etc. where the experiment took place.
attributes.example: INRA, UE Diascope - Chemin de Mezouls - Domaine expérimental de Melgueil - 34130 Mauguio - France

attributes.name: Latitude
attributes.label: Geographic location (latitude)
attributes.definition: Latitude of the experimental site in degrees, in decimal format.

attributes.name: Longitude
attributes.label: Geographic location (longitude)
attributes.definition: Longititute of the experimental site in degrees, in decimal format.

attributes.name: Altitude
attributes.label: Geographic location (altitude)
attributes.definition: Altitude of the experimental site, preferably provided in metres (m).

models.name: MiappeExp
models.definition: A MIAPPE standard plant phenotyping experiment, comprising a series of assays (or measurements) of one or more types, undertaken to answer a particular biological question.

attributes.name: StatisticalDesign
attributes.label: Description of statistical design
attributes.definition: Short description of the statistical design.
attributes.example: Lines were repeated twice at each location using a complete block design. In order to limit competition effects, each block was organized into four sub-blocks corresponding to earliness groups based on a priori information. https://urgi.versailles.inra.fr/files/ephesis/181000503/181000503_plan.xls

attributes.name: StatisticalDesignType
attributes.label: Type of statistical design
attributes.definition: Type of statistical design of the experiment, in the form of an accession number from the Crop Ontology.

attributes.name: ObsUnitHierarchy
attributes.label: Observation unit level hierarchy
attributes.definition: Hierarchy of the different levels of repetitions between each others

attributes.name: ObsUnitDescription
attributes.label: Observation unit description
attributes.definition: General description of the observation units in the experiment.
attributes.example: Observation units consisted in individual plots themselves consisting of a row of 15 plants at a density of approximately six plants per square meter

attributes.name: GrowthFacilityDesc
attributes.label: Description of growth facility
attributes.definition: Short description of the facility in which the experiment was carried out.

attributes.name: GrowthFacilityType
attributes.label: Type of growth facility
attributes.definition: Type of growth facility in which the experiment was carried out, in the form of an accession number from the Crop Ontology.

attributes.name: CulturalPractices
attributes.label: Cultural practices
attributes.definition: General description of the cultural practices of the experiment.
attributes.example: Irrigation was applied according needs during summer to prevent water stress.

attributes.name: ExpDesignMap
attributes.label: Map of experimental design
attributes.definition: Representation of the experimental design.

models.name: Person
models.definition: A human involved in a project/experiment.

attributes.name: Name
attributes.label: Person name
attributes.definition: The name of the person (either full name or as used in scientific publications)

attributes.name: PersonID
attributes.label: Person ID
attributes.definition: An identifier for the data submitter. If that submitter is an individual, ORCID identifiers are recommended.

attributes.name: Email
attributes.label: Person email
attributes.definition: The electronic mail address of the person.

attributes.name: Role
attributes.label: Person role
attributes.definition: Type of contribution of the person to the investigation

attributes.name: Affiliation
attributes.label: Person affiliation
attributes.definition: The institution the person belongs to

models.name: DataFile
models.label: Data File
models.definition: A file or digital object holding observation data recorded during one or more assays of the experiment, typically in tabular form. Multiple data files may be provided per experiment, and each file can include observations for several observation units and several observed variables.

attributes.name: FileLink
attributes.label: Data file link
attributes.definition: Link to the data file (or digital object) in a public database or institutional repository; or identifier of the data file when submitted together with the MIAPPE submission.

attributes.name: FileDesc
attributes.label: Data file description
attributes.definition: Description of the format of the data file. May be a standard file format name, or a description of organization of the data in a tabular file.
attributes.example: FASTA; tab-delineated, column headers headers: 1. A 2. B 3. C

attributes.name: FileVersion
attributes.label: Data file version
attributes.definition: The version of the dataset (the actual data).

models.name: BioMaterial
models.label: Biological Material
models.definition: The biological material being studied (e.g. plants grown from a certain bag or seed, or plants grown in a particular field). The original source of that material (e.g., the seeds or the original plant cloned) is called the material source, which, when held by a material repository, should have its stock identified.

attributes.name: BioMatID
attributes.label: Biological material ID
attributes.definition: Code used to identify the biological material in the data file. Should be unique within the Investigation. Can correspond to experimental plant ID, seed lot ID, etc...

attributes.name: Organism
attributes.label: Organism
attributes.definition: An identifier for the organism at the species level. Use of the NCBI taxon ID is recommended.

attributes.name: Genus
attributes.label: Genus
attributes.definition: Genus name for the organism under experiment, according to standard scientific nomenclature.

attributes.name: Species
attributes.label: Species
attributes.definition: Species name for  the organism under experiment, according to standard scientific nomenclature.

attributes.name: BioMatLatitude
attributes.label: Biological material latitude
attributes.definition: Latitude of the studied biological material. [Alternative identifier for in situ material]

attributes.name: BioMatLongitude
attributes.label: Biological material longitude
attributes.definition: Longitude of the studied biological material. [Alternative identifier for in situ material]

attributes.name: BioMatAltitude
attributes.label: Biological material altitude
attributes.definition: Altitude of the studied biological material, preferably provided in metres (m). [Alternative identifier for in situ material]

attributes.name: BioMatCoordUncertainty
attributes.label: Biological material coordinates uncertainty
attributes.definition: Circular uncertainty of the coordinates, preferably provided in meters (m). [Alternative identifier for in situ material]

attributes.name: BioMatPreprocessing
attributes.label: Biological material preprocessing
attributes.definition: Description of any process or treatment applied uniformely to the biological material, prior to the experiment itself. Can be provided as free text or as an accession number from a suitable controlled vocabulary.
attributes.example: EO:0007210 - PVY(NTN); transplanted from experiment http://phenome-fppn.fr/maugio/2013/t2351 observation unit ID : pot:894
attributes.format: Plant Environment Ontology and/or free text

attributes.name: MatSourceID
attributes.label: Material source ID (Holding institute/stock centre, accession)
attributes.definition: An identifier for the source of the biological material, in the form of a key-value pair comprising the name/identifer of the repository from which the material was sourced plus the accession number of the repository for that material. Where an accession number has not been assigned, but the material has been derived from the crossing of known accessions, the material can be defined as follows: mother_accession X father_accession, or, if father is unknown, as mother_accession X UNKNOWN. For in situ material, the region of provenance may be used when an accession is not available.

attributes.name: MatSourceDOI
attributes.label: Material source DOI
attributes.definition: Digital Object Identifier (DOI) of the material source

attributes.name: MatSourceLatitude
attributes.label: Material source latitude
attributes.definition: Latitude of the material source. [Alternative identifier for in situ material]

attributes.name: MatSourceLongitude
attributes.label: Material source longitude
attributes.definition: Longitude of the material source. [Alternative identifier for in situ material]

attributes.name: MatSourceAltitude
attributes.label: Material source altitude
attributes.definition: Altitude of the material source, preferably provided in metres (m). [Alternative identifier for in situ material]

attributes.name: MatSourceCoordUncertainty
attributes.label: Material source coordinates uncertainty
attributes.definition: Circular uncertainty of the coordinates, preferably provided in meters (m). [Alternative identifier for in situ material]

attributes.name: MatSourceDescription
attributes.label: Material source description
attributes.definition: Description of the material source
attributes.example: Branches were collected from a 10-year-old tree growing in a progeny trial established in a loamy brown earth soil

models.name: EnviroParam
models.label: Environmental Parameter
models.definition: An environmental parameter or experimental condition that was kept constant throughout the experiment and did not change betweeen observation units or assays.

attributes.name: EnvParameter
attributes.label: Environment parameter
attributes.definition: Name of the environment parameter
attributes.example: List environmental parameters in attachment to main MIAPPE table.Examples: air temperature; rooting medium; medium composition; plot size

attributes.name: Value
attributes.label: Environment parameter value
attributes.definition: Value of the environment parameter.
attributes.example: Value for each of the above parameters.Examples: 22 °C; Ca: 5 mg/L

models.name: Factor
models.definition: The object of a experiment is to ascertain the impact of one or more factors on the biological material. Thus, a factor is, by definition a condition that varies between observation units, which may be biotic (pest, disease interaction) or abiotic (treatment and cultural practice) in nature.

attributes.name: FactorType
attributes.label: Factor type
attributes.definition: Name/Acronym of the factor.

attributes.name: FactorDesc
attributes.label: Factor description
attributes.definition: Free text description of the factor. This include all relevant treatments planificaito and protocole considered for all the plant targeted by a given factor.

attributes.name: FactorValues
attributes.label: Factor values
attributes.definition: List of possible values for the factor.

models.name: Event
models.definition: An event is discrete occurrence at a particular time in the experiment (which can be natural, such as rain, or unnatural, such as planting, watering, etc). Events may be the realization of Factors or parts of Factors, or may be confounding to Factors. Can be applied at the whole experiment level or to only a subset of observation units.

attributes.name: EventType
attributes.label: Event type
attributes.definition: Short name of the event.

attributes.name: EventAcession
attributes.label: Event acession number
attributes.definition: Accession number of the event type in a suitable controlled vocabulary (Crop Ontology) if available.

attributes.name: EventDesc
attributes.label: Event description
attributes.definition: Description of the event, including details such as amount applied and possibly duration of the event.
attributes.example: Grafting; Fertilizer application, Ammonium nitrate at 3 kg/m2; sowing

attributes.name: EventDateTime
attributes.label: Event date
attributes.definition: Date and time of the event.

models.name: ObsUnit
models.label: Observation Unit
models.definition: Observation units are objects that are subject to particular instances of observsation and measurement. An observation unit comprises one or more plants, and their environment. Synonym : Experimental unit.

attributes.name: ObsUnitID
attributes.label: Observation unit ID
attributes.definition: Identifier used to identify the observation unit in data files containing the values observed or measured on that unit. Must be locally unique

attributes.name: ObsUnitType
attributes.label: Observation unit type
attributes.definition: Type of observation unit in textual form.
attributes.example: block, sub-lock, plot, plant, trial, sample, pot, replication or replicate, individual, virtual_trial, unit-parcel

attributes.name: ExternalID
attributes.label: External ID
attributes.definition: Identifier for the observation unit in a persistant repository, comprises the name of the repository and the identifier of the observation unit therein. The EBI Biosamples repository is recommended.

attributes.name: ObsUnitFactorVals
attributes.label: Observation Unit factor value
attributes.definition: List of values for each factor applied to the observation unit.

models.name: SpatialCoord
models.definition: Type and value of a spatial coordinate (georeference or relative) or level of observation (plot 45, subblock 7, block 2) provided as a key-value pair of the form [type] value. Levels of observation must be consistent with those listed in the MiappeExp section.

attributes.name: SPKey
attributes.label: Key
attributes.definition: The Type of a spatial coordinate entry, which pairs with a value to give a full Spatial Coordinate point.
attributes.example: Latitude, row, X, Y, Block, Plot (one per key entry)

attributes.name: SPValue
attributes.label: Value
attributes.definition: The Value of a spatial coordinate entry, which pairs with a Type to give a full Spatial Coordinate point.

models.name: Sample
models.definition: A sample is a portion of plant tissue extracted from an observation unit for the purpose of sub-plant observations and/or molecular studies.

attributes.name: SampleID
attributes.label: Sample ID
attributes.definition: Unique identifier for the sample.

attributes.name: PlantDevStage
attributes.label: Plant structure development stage
attributes.definition: The stage in the life of a plant structure during which the sample was taken, in the form of an accession number to a suitable controlled vocabulary (Plant Ontology, BBCH scale)
attributes.format: Plant Ontology term (subclass or PO:0009012) or BBCH scale term

attributes.name: PlantAnatomicalEntity
attributes.label: Plant anatomical entity
attributes.definition: A description of  the plant part (e.g. leaf) or the plant product (e.g. resin) from which the sample was taken, in the form of an accession number to a suitable controlled vocabulary (Plant Ontology).

attributes.name: SampleDesc
attributes.label: Sample description
attributes.definition: Any information not captured by the other sample fields, including quantification, sample treatments and processing.
attributes.example: Distal part of the leaf ; 100mg of roots taken from 10 roots at 20°C, conserved in vacuum at 20mM NaCl salinity, stored at -60 °C to -85 °C.

attributes.name: CollectionDate
attributes.label: Collection date
attributes.definition: The date and time when the sample was collected / harvested

attributes.name: ExternalID
attributes.label: External ID
attributes.definition: An identifier for the sample in a persistant repository, comprising the name of the repository and the accession number of the observation unit therein. Submission to the EBI Biosamples repository is recommended

models.name: ObsVariable
models.label: Observed Variable
models.definition: An observed variable, typically taking the form of a measured characteristic of the observation unit (plant or environmental trait), associated to the method and unit of measurement.

attributes.name: VariableID
attributes.label: Variable ID
attributes.definition: Code used to identify the variable in the data file. We recommend using a variable definition from the Crop Ontology where possible. Otherwise, the Crop Ontology naming convention is recommended: <trait abbreviation>_<method abbreviation>_<scale abbreviation>). A variable ID must be unique within a given investigation.

attributes.name: VariableName
attributes.label: Variable name
attributes.definition: Name of the variable.
attributes.example: Anthesis computed in growing degree days

attributes.name: VariableAccession
attributes.label: Variable accession number
attributes.definition: Accession number of the variable in the Crop Ontology (if available)

attributes.name: Trait
attributes.label: Trait
attributes.definition: Name of the (plant or environmental) trait under observation

attributes.name: TraitAccession
attributes.label: Trait accession number
attributes.definition: Accession number of the trait in a suitable controlled vocabulary (Crop Ontology, Trait Ontology).
attributes.format: Term from Plant Trait Ontology, Crop Ontology, or XML Environment Ontology

attributes.name: Method
attributes.label: Method
attributes.definition: Name of the method of observation

attributes.name: MethodAccession
attributes.label: Method accession number
attributes.definition: Accession number of the method in a suitable controlled vocabulary (Crop Ontology, Trait Ontology).
attributes.format: Term from Plant Trait Ontology, Crop Ontology, or XML Environment Ontology

attributes.name: MethodDesc
attributes.label: Method description
attributes.definition: Textual description of the method, which may extend a method defined in an external reference with specific parameters, e.g. growth stage, inoculation precise organ (leaf number)
attributes.example: 1/ Days to anthesis for male flowering was measured in thermal time (GDD: growing degree-days) according to Ritchie J, NeSmith D (1991;Temperature and crop development. Modeling plant a nd soil systems American Society of Agronomy Madison, Wisconsin USA) with TBASE=8°C and T0=30°C.2/ Plant height was measured at 5 years with a ruler, one year after Botritis inoculation.

attributes.name: MethodReference
attributes.label: Reference associated to the method
attributes.definition: URI/DOI of reference describing the method.

attributes.name: Scale
attributes.label: Scale
attributes.definition: Name of the scale associated with the variable

attributes.name: ScaleAccession
attributes.label: Scale accession number
attributes.definition: Accession number of the scale in a suitable controlled vocabulary (Crop Ontology).

attributes.name: TimeScale
attributes.label: Time scale
attributes.definition: Name of the scale or unit of time with which observations of this type were recorded in the data file (for time series studies).
